title: Proverbs of Programmers
synopsis: Sayings and small truths distilled from ages of debugging; the wisdom scroll of humility, humor, and human error.

sections.title: Proverbs of the Command Line

verses.text: He who types `sudo rm -rf /` shall remember that power without caution is ruin.
Do not test in production, unless thou art production.
A short script done today is worth ten frameworks planned tomorrow.

notes: The tone of this book mirrors ancient Near Eastern proverbs with modern bite.

sections.title: Proverbs of Team and Ego

verses.text: Commit often, for memory is fleeting and your teammates are forgetful.
Argue not in code reviews for victory, but for clarity.
The humble developer fixeth silently; the proud one writes a Medium post.

notes: Cited by managers and monks alike as a model of graceful cooperation.

sections.title: Proverbs of Creation

verses.text: The best code is the one that need not be written.
A function that does one thing well endureth forever.
He who names things rightly shapes reality.
